title: Feature: Create Neuraxle-Tensorflow documentation example AND documentation notebook page

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We need one documentation notebook that talks of saving and of the reasons why we need to do it like that with `create_model`, `create_loss` and `create_optimizer`. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
1. Create `gallery example` of a very simple `tf.nn.Dense` in `create_model` (linear regression) with MSE loss for fitting on the boston housing dataset [just like here](https://www.neuraxle.org/stable/examples/sklearn/plot_boston_housing_meta_optimization.html#sphx-glr-examples-sklearn-plot-boston-housing-meta-optimization-py) but with a simpler pipeline and using xle-tf. 
2. A documentation page (notebook-like) that could be similar to [this page](https://www.neuraxle.org/stable/step_saving_and_lifecycle.html) for instance (not an example gallery). This page would also explain and state the conditions for this to work, similarly to the list of 4 conditions to respect in #406 to make sure that the reader understand how it works and what are the requisites. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Pointing people to this page instead, but it is both too complicated and almost outdated: https://github.com/guillaume-chevalier/seq2seq-signal-prediction 

**Additional context**
The documentation page could also point to the famous seq2seq example linked just above for people who'd like more info. The seq2seq notebook example could also be refactored into a **gallery example** and with a link to the original page in the code for readers to have an easier reading of the code.
